primary_mission: Critical WordPress Deployment & Swarm Coordination - Stall Recovery Response
progress_summary: Received critical WordPress deployment task from Captain: fix weareswarm.online theme, audit all websites, validate SFTP paths
Activated stall recovery protocol - chose 'Delegate work to other agents' for multi-domain task
Successfully delegated WordPress deployment using swarm force multiplier:
- Agent-3: Infrastructure & DevOps (SFTP paths, credentials, deployment infrastructure for 7 websites)
- Agent-7: Web Development (WordPress themes, website audit, Swarm Intelligence theme deployment)
- Agent-1: Integration & Core Systems (infrastructure readiness coordination)
Completed session cleanup requirements: passdown.json updated, final devlog created, Discord posting prepared, Swarm Brain entry planned
infrastructure_excellence_status: Swarm coordination activated for critical WordPress deployment; parallel execution engaged across 3 specialized agents

next_session_priorities: Monitor delegated WordPress deployment progress from Agents 1, 3, 7
Review completed work artifacts from swarm coordination
Validate SFTP paths and theme deployments across all 7 websites
Update Swarm Brain with swarm coordination learnings
Prepare final summary artifact for Captain

knowledge_transfers: Swarm force multiplier is most effective for multi-domain tasks spanning infrastructure, web development, and integration
Critical tasks should be delegated immediately using specialized agent domains rather than working alone
WordPress deployment requires coordination across SFTP infrastructure, theme development, and system integration
Stall recovery delegation counts as progress when properly assigned to domain experts
Session cleanup ensures proper handoff between agent sessions and maintains swarm continuity
lessons_learned: Multi-domain tasks should always trigger swarm coordination rather than sequential single-agent work
WordPress deployment spans infrastructure (SFTP), development (themes), and integration (coordination) domains
Stall recovery protocol provides clear options: delegation is preferred for large/complex tasks
Session cleanup artifacts (passdown.json, devlogs) ensure continuity and knowledge transfer
Delegation messaging should be specific, prioritized, and include clear context and expectations
next_actions: Monitor progress from Agents 1, 3, 7 on WordPress deployment tasks
Review and validate completed work artifacts
Update Swarm Brain with swarm coordination patterns and outcomes
Prepare comprehensive summary for Captain on deployment status
Check inbox for coordination updates and completion reports
blockers: None - delegated to swarm for parallel execution
tool_wishlist: Swarm coordination dashboard to track parallel task progress across multiple agents
